summary: Reduces the plastic doll effect caused by a High ENB Specular Amount.
descriptionHtml:
[img]http://static-1.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/31782-2-1397233622.jpg[/img]

For those who don't like plastic dolls caused by High ENB Specular Amount.

[size=1](Noisy - More Dry used in the above image)[/size]

========================================================================================

[color=yellow][size=3][u][b]IMPORTANT:[/b][/u][/size][/color]

If you use TexBlendLite or the Standalone Texture Blender it's recommended to run those tools before installing this or you might end up with a Neck Seam.

[color=GreenYellow][size=3][u][b]Installation:[/b][/u][/size][/color]

1) Download one of the files for your Body Mod.
2) Open the archive with WinRar or 7-Zip.
3) Delete all folders except the one you want to use.
4) Close the archive.
5) Add the Mod to Nexus Mod Manager.
6) Activate the Mod. (Yes, when asked to overwrite)

Done!

========================================================================================

[color=GreenYellow][size=3][u][b]Additional info:[/b][/u][/size][/color]

If you use extreme High Specular Amounts you still get Gloss/Shine. This was designed for a specular setting as high as 1.50.

========================================================================================

[color=GreenYellow][size=6][u][b]Failed to Save File or Black Body/Face:[/b][/u][/size][/color]

[size=3][b]Problem:[/b] [color=orange]Failed to Save File.[/color]
[b]Cause:[/b] Skyrim installed in "Program Files (x86)".
[b]Solution:[/b] Adjust "config.xml" as explained below.

[b]Problem:[/b] [color=orange]Black Body/Face after blending.[/color]
[b]Cause:[/b] No source textures found, unable to detect Skyrim Data folder (could be related to the Skyrim INI files)
[b]Solution:[/b] Adjust "config.xml" as explained below.[/size]

1) Go to the folder where "TexBlend.exe" is located.
2) Open "Config.xml" with [url=http://notepad-plus-plus.org/download/v6.6.3.html]NotePad++[/url].

There are two paths shown in Green (Line 6 and 10):

<!-- <GameDataPath>D:|steam|steamapps|common|skyrim|Data|</GameDataPath>

and

<!-- <TexOutputPath>C:|steam|steamapps|common|skyrim|Data|</TexOutputPath>

3) Change the path in both lines to where your Skyrim Data Folder is located.
4) Remove "<!--" infront of both lines. (it should change color to Blue and Black)
5) Save the file.

Done!

========================================================================================

[color=GreenYellow][size=3][u][b]Credits and Special Thanks:[/b][/u][/size][/color]

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=6709]dimon99[/url], [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/2666]Caliente[/url] and [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=6554&navtag=file/images.php?id=6554&tab=3]Navetsea[/url]
